Reviews.Title: “Still a hidden gem - loved Hotel Otto!!!”
Reviews.Author: Eurasian71
Reviews.Content: ambivalent: should I recommend this wonderful hotel in Berlin and it will be crowded the next time I want to check in there or should I share my great experience with them? :-) Just kidding... I really loved this place - it is very central, wonderful neighborhood, anything you need is nearby. The hotel itself is quite new (or newly renovated) in a fresh, young designed way. The staff is more than great - I checked in a bit too early, but that wasn't a problem at all. They arranged for an already cleaned room (and gave me an upgrade - yeah!), so I could refresh before starting my tour in Berlin (I had booked online for the Gerhard Richter exhibition for that day). On the top floor where you can have breakfast in the morning (which I had not the chance to try as I was already dated for brunch with friends…) there is a nice lounge with a wonderful balcony - and from afternoon till evening you can grab coffee and tea and water and cake and similar stuff for free - while reading some newspaper or magazines provided as well or enjoy the wonderful view.... And there are always bottles of water for free at the "ottomat" on the basement - a quite well equipped vending machine as substitute to a fridge in every room. The snacks are very "organic" (nothing for me with a soya allergy), but the offered drinks where excellent (Penfolds Shiraz, very good!!). The elevator which stops between two floors, so you have to go up or down half the stairways (no problem for me, but maybe worth to mention), is quite cute as well:  bird's twittering inside feels like being in a forest. My room was huge with an extra dressing area, very comfy bed, flat TV etc. The only two minor criticism are the light smell of fresh paint (?! It smelled like the door frame got fresh color recently…) and, as my room was next to the stairway, a bit noisy in the middle of the night when other quite young guests came back from clubbing. But in Berlin you cannot expect totally quiet location. And one thing to mention: The reception staff is only there till 11pm, if this matters to someone... - for me it wasn't. Keys etc worked very properly. Oh, and visit the coffee shop next door, GIRO. Nice design, very good coffee and friendly staff as well.... So, I will be back soon in Hotel Otto - that's for sure. Thanks to the staff and auf Wiedersehen in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dgbdgbdgb
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed a four night stay in this hotel recently. It is in a nice quiet street lined with bookshops, hotels and nice eating places, close to Ernst Reuter Platz. The hotel has very distinctive internal design style. And the staff are incredibly helpful. The top floor restaurant is open for breakfast, but in the afternoon is open for free tea/coffee and cakes - very nice touch, as the sun comes through the window, there is a balcony and very pleasant place to relax. The room was well equipped, free wifi (although you need 24 hour tokens to use) and the mattress was just right - not too firm, nor too soft. The lift is brilliant. No food in the evening, but there are loads of good places within a short walking distance. Only drawback I can see is that you have to navigate a short set of steps up to the lift from each floor level, so not suitable if you have limited mobility. But otherwise highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Shelle1001
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and it was awesome! Great location, friendly helpful staff (who spoke great English) and beautifully updated rooms. We ended up getting the penthouse suite which had a full kitchen, living room, dining room and bedroom. It was a great room for 4 people. Being on the top level, we were right across the hall from the dining which could not have been more convenient. I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel that really goes the extra mile”
Reviews.Author: emsieb39
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a lovely Easter weekend at hotel otto and would definitely stay again if we go back to Berlin. Rooms are modern, spacious and comfortable with free water and fruit on arrival. The breakfast is amazing, a huge selection of lovely fresh food and we all received a chocolate easter bunny on the Sunday. Equally it's worth returning to the hotel in the afternoon to relax with tea and cake (all included) in the sunny lounge. All the staff were friendly and helpful, pointing out the best local restaurants and travel routes. Otto is a slow 10 min walk to s or u Bahn for connections across the city. There's also a car park if you need it and a vending machine dispensing those food essentials - wine and beer. Highly recommended, plus push the surprise button in the lift- if you dare ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel great location superb city”
Reviews.Author: chatts99
Reviews.Content: Only stayed 2 nights and didnt get to use the breakfast/afternoon tea lounge during the day. however my room was excellent very well appointed. Slightly unusual set up for me in that reception is not 24HR although wasnt a problem(dont lose your key though LOL) reception staff were very helpful and attentive on arrival and informative for an early departure. Location was perfect for me 2 mins walk from local metro 8 mins walk from Zoo Station with multiple connections. I would highly reccomend this hotel for second time visitors to Berlin, business travellers, couples. Maybe not so for those visitors that perhaps like the "slightly overpowering" feel of a big chain. Surronding area full of very nice restaurants and bars had no worries walking around late at night

Reviews.Title: “Bargain designer hotel”
Reviews.Author: reevsie70
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely week at Hotel Otto. Staff were friendly and helpful and there are lots of nice touches to add to your stay (my favourite was the birdsong in the lift ;)). Our room was very spacious, bright, modern, comfortable and quiet. We indulged in a champers breakfast to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday and tucked into a decent spread on the seventh floor enjoying views over the rooftops of Berlin (about 15 euros each for as much as you can eat/ drink). The hotel is located minutes from the S bahn station Savignyplatz (easy access to Alexanderplatz) and walking distance from the zoo. Although not a particularly lively area for those looking for midweek nightlife in March when we stayed, there were plenty of lovely restaurants around for exhausted sightseers like us with outside space for when the weather turns warmer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Dima T
Reviews.Content: Really good one in Berlin Room: enough space, clean, well-equipped Bath: clean, comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay and delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: pcoscarelli
Reviews.Content: I passed a wonderful long week-end with my family in this small and cousy hotel in Berlin. The hotel is new with design furniture and located in one of the best location of Berlin, moreover is perfectly connected with the other Berlin local attractions. Rooms have design furnitures and a lot of little attentions (like brush and toothpaste or shawing kit), bathroom is quite small but well equipped and new as well. All the employees take care of all your needs and let feel you like at home (cause it was my father birthday they leave also a little present on his room upon-arrival). Breakfast gourgeous in the roof-top: absolutely to try!!! If I'll have the chance to come back in Berlin, I'll surely book again at this hotel! Concluding

Reviews.Title: “Highly priced”
Reviews.Author: Maleknass
Reviews.Content: If you are on a business trip this might not be the best place to stay in Berlin. For the same value you can get better located hotels, with more amenities. The one thing that bothered me the most was the fresh paint smell. The Dining lounge in the top floor was the nicest thing about the hotel. The breakfast served was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: EBS5
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a four-day trip to Berlin. I've always stayed in the area near Savignyplatz, but this was my first time at the Hotel Otto. It was incredibly easy to get there by bus (X9) from Tegel Airport, and there are good public transportation connections nearby from Ernst-Reuter-Platz (U-Bahn) as well as Savignyplatz (S-Bahn). The hotel is also on a street with several cafes and bookshops. The Otto staff was always very helpful and friendly. I had a spacious single room facing the back that included a kitchenette. Mineral water is free and you can get a new bottle each day if you request it. If you're allergic to down duvets/pillows, they offer a synthetic option. The room was clean and quiet and the entire hotel is well maintained. I didn't eat breakfast there since the cost was pretty high, which I would say is the only downside of the Otto. Thankfully there are many inexpensive food options throughout the city, so that's not a huge issue. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Tejaask
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Berlin, enjoying studio room in Hotel Otto. It has great location 200m from U-Bahn station, with lots of nice food restaurants next to it. Value for money was great and staff was always helpful and nice. Breakfast is 15€/prsn, which is too expensive, as near by coffee houses serve 2 persons easily under 13€. But they have afternoon and evenings free coffee/tea/cake at 7th floor. I can stronly recommend this hotel, if you want good quality accommodation and you are not looking for 'normal' hotel.

Reviews.Title: “you can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: sarahfromnyc
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed at hotel otto for three nights in may 2011 and had a great experience. we didn't wind up using it, but our room had a great little kitchen in addition to a nice, very clean bath and plenty of space. i always expect european hotel rooms to be super tiny and this was among the largest rooms i've stayed in anywhere. our room also had huge windows that let in lots of natural light and gave us a nice view of the street below. coming from new york, my husband and i are always fearful of staying in the times square of whatever city we're visiting. and that was also a nice perk of being at hotel otto. we really liked the location, it felt more real and neighborhood-y, not in the heart of tourism but still very accessible to it. our flight got into berlin fairly early in the morning, sooner than we expected to be able to check in, but the staff let us borrow a room to change our clothes and rearrange our things before leaving them at reception for the day. oh! hotel otto also has free snacks in the afternoon, a perfect pick-me-up for the weary traveler. it wasn't quite warm enough when we were there, but there was a nice outdoor terrace to sit out on and enjoy a tea or coffee. it was an overall great experience, one i'd definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Highly over rated”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca P
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel was the italian restaurant across the street. I arrived after 11pm which apparently the reception desk is closed. I was prompted by the man behind the buzzer what my room number was and he slid a key through a slot. There was no one at the desk to greet me just a buzz with a key. I was a woman traveling alone and did not feel safe at all by this!! There is no where that this states this is how you will be greeted. I then got to my room and wanted to get on to the internet to tell my family I was safe (even though I did not feel very safe in this hotel!) I called the reception line where they didn't understand me speaking in english and the man could not help me with the internet and told me he was hanging up the phone. RUDE customer service!! The next morning I found out that the internet does not support MAC products so beware when booking this hotel. After asking they did suggest an internet cafe 10 minutes away. The reception desk is not always available even in the daytime. Please be advised when booking this hotel. If you are okay with these things than you will find a clean hotel otherwise. I will not be staying here again. It ruined my Berlin experience! Thank you hotel otto.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...”
Reviews.Author: Steph N
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over New Year and was very impressed with the hotel. Bedrooms were very large and were simple but modern, and staff were friendly and helpful. The location was perfect, with the train line (that runs through the main stations) just 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Also the street the hotel is on is full of lovely restaurants, so you will never have a problem finding somewhere to eat! The hotel also provides free drinks and cakes/biscuits in the afternoon which is an added bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel”
Reviews.Author: TedSouthWales
Reviews.Content: A friend and i stayed at the Otto on a trip to Berlin to take in the sites and shop at the Christmas markets - which I would certainly recommend. The hotel is well situated, after getting on the U Bahn from the airport, with one change we arrived at the station just minutes from the hotel. There are also many good restaurants in the vicinity which we tried & enjoyed. We had a warm, informative welcome at the hotel, our room was on the ground floor, small but very clean. Being on the ground floor I initially had concerns about noise, but we heard nothing! We didn't book breakfast as we were our early each morning, there is a nice coffee shop and a deli reached by turning left out of the hotel door. We did partake in the free cake & tea/coffee available of the top floor each afternoon - nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: tb1966
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 2 teenage sons. A few days before I emailed about luggage storage and recived a swift reply. However on arriving at 11 our room was in fact ready and we were able to check straight in.We had a comfort room and it was huge. minimilst furniture but suitbale for a few nights stay. the beds were large, there was a dressing room and alarge bathroom. the staff were welcoming and helpful. The breakfast although al.oittle expensive was plentilful and there was so much choice even for my boys!!. the free coffee and cakes till 9pm was very welcome. Again we were able to leave our luggage at the hotel on our departure date until quite late in the day.The location is near to the S bahn and to some nice eating places and within walking distance of shopping areas. We had a pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “Not worth all the praise written here before but ok after room change”
Reviews.Author: rtmakela
Reviews.Content: I've visited Berlin a few times before and stayed at different hotels. Until now this hotel has been the only one little bit disappointing accomodation experience. Hotel Otto has been made in a house that has served before as an apartment building. I think the change has been made a little bit "cheaply". The age of the building shows. You would not build a hotel with this kind of floorplans today. The room doors are not very sound proof. A modern image has been chased by using Artemide lamps We had booked a standard room and we were given one near the reception. Unfortunately the room clearly had an indoor air problem. Also you could here sounds of every conversation at the reception desk and quite a lot traffic noise too. They couldn't give us another standard room but we could get a comfort room which costed a little bit more. This one was ok but facing the street at the second floor had morning traffic noise too. I think no one should be given a room like we got at first. There were no apologies. The breakfast was, as said so many times here before, very good.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfully weird experience!”
Reviews.Author: ottawa_mjp
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? Hotel Otto is an interesting, artsy hotel. The rooms were big and airy with tons of closet space and a large bathroom. We were quite comfortable. You'll be within walking distance of the Berlin Zoo, KaDeWe (an amazingly large department store with food you can buy for breakfasts, lunches etc), restaurants and of course, the U and S-bahn systems. It was fairly easy to get where we wanted to go and at a reasonable price. What more could you need?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Janette91
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here with my husband and agree with what other reviewers have said. We only had a standard room, which wasn't huge but had everything we needed and was good value (particularly the free afternoon coffee and cake!). The staff were very friendly and although breakfast wasn't included in the price there were lots of cafes nearby. We really liked the neighbourhood and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, modern, basic and a gorgeous breakfast room”
Reviews.Author: TwoForksintheRoad
Reviews.Content: This is a minimalist hotel - in the tasteful and modern sense of the word. Go for the slightly larger rooms - small additional price, big additional comfort. The breakfast room on the top floor is amazing - spare but modern, outdoor space, fantastic views and a great buffet. Great design touches everywhere. Hotel Otto is not 100% full service - you open the doors at night with a key - but don't be precious. The value for money is super.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: JEP75214
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Otto for nine nights in October 2011, during our first visit to Berlin. We had a spacious room in the back -- very quiet and comfortable. We loved the neighborhood -- charming and very walkable. Most important, the hotel is close to public transport -- bus or U-bahn -- for travel all over the city and to TXL. We could easily travel to the Mitte or other areas east, then return to the hotel for quiet relaxation. We especially appreciated the free refreshments upstairs in the late afternoon -- resting our feet and gazing out over rooftops on the balcony while enjoying a cup of coffee and a pastry or mini sandwich. A very civilized touch. The staff was wonderful -- always gracious and courteous and willing to assist with any need. We spoke next-to-no German, so appreciated their willingness to help us make some special arrangements. Also loved the free WiFi. We would gladly return here -- it seemed like home in Berlin. Not inexpensive, but we thought we got a lot for our money.

Reviews.Title: “High quality no nonsense budget boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: CRDK
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a one night stay in Berlin where we wanted to be in a central spot close to the restaurant Paris Bar. We travelled with 2 teenagers and had a nice family room at the fourth floor facing the street. We found the hotel very much to our satisfaction, the staff very friendly/helpful, and the breakfast buffet lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Superfantastich Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monkeynonymous
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel with great individual character. The studio apartment became a real home from home and was clean, spacious, well-equipped and modern but it's the little touches that really make it. You can really relax here and enjoy taking your time over a wonderful breakfast or after a busy day in Berlin chill out with free tea and cake in the upstairs lounge. The staff were welcoming and very helpful. The hotel is quiet and in a safe and attractive location but close to good transport links. It ticked all the boxes for me.

Reviews.Title: “Bucks Fizz and Salmon for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: susie1964
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Otto for 3 nights. We flew into Schonefeld with Easyjet and got the Airport express RB14 (direction Nauen) to the Zoological Gardens and then the S Bahn to Savignyplatz. The best parts: - We stayed in a Comfort Room which was located at the back of the Hotel, had a Juliet Balcony, and was spacious with its own dressing room. It was very quiet. I loved the Bucks Fizz and Salmon for breakfast and my fussy partner who loves English breakfast even found cooked breakfast that he enjoyed German style. There was a great selection of meats, cheeses and drinks available and the service was excellent. Afternoon tea, coffee, cakes and rolls were all served free of charge on the 7th floor restaurant until 9pm. Received great service from the receptionists regarding travel (they printed off train timetables for us) tourist attractions and places to eat. We enjoyed all of the restaurants that were recommended to us. This hotel is located in the leafy Suburban area in the West of Berlin, however most attractions are in the East of Berlin, but this is not a problem at all with the efficient german trains and buses available. The worst bit:- Not having tea and coffee facilities or a mini bar in the room. All in all we enjoyed our stay in Berlin, felt it was value for money and would highly recommend the Hotel. Top tip make sure you hit the surprise button in the lift!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, essentials missing”
Reviews.Author: luuk-schouteten
Reviews.Content: Having read the excellent reviews of this place I stayed there recently while in Berlin for a conference. Staff is very friendly and helpful, rooms are spacious, although minimalistic and mine was shower-only. Missing: mini-bar, coffee-making facilities, (I know there's the roof terrace, but it's nice not to have to leave your room for coffee or tea when you're working). Also airconditioning would be nice as the rooms at the back of the hotel have large windows in the sun all afternoon. Lack of a bar or restaurant in the hotel is not a big issue as there are plenty in te vicinity. Conclusion, location great, staff excellent, with a couple of small improvements it could be a great place as opposed to just very good value for money. Oh and if Otto's management is reading this: the bird-sounds in the elevator are cute the first time, but after a couple of days they do get annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Super!”
Reviews.Author: Readytogybe
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, well placed near Savignyplatz and the Zoo Station in leafy street with lots of restaurants and bars nearby. We got the X9 airport bus from Tegel and got off at Ernst Reuter Platz from which the hotel is 5 minutes. Lots of nice touches like free tea, coffee and cake each afternoon on the roof terrace, and free water in room. We had a large comfort room at the back of the hotel. Staff were great, really welcoming and helpful. We hope to be back soon! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Hotel Otto made our trip to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Judy N
Reviews.Content: We are sure we would not have enjoyed Berlin nearly as much if we had not stayed in the Hotel Otto. There is very little I can add to previous reviews extolling the virtues of this hotel, the most important one being it's location in a lovely, safe and walkable area of Berlin. The hotel design is simple but chic and imaginative, and the cafe on the top floor a huge plus. The weather was beautiful when we we there, and we had great pleasure sitting outside on the terrace watching night fall over the big city. We were in one of their least expensive rooms, which was smallish but adequate. (A previous reviewer stated that all rooms are a generous size and come with kitchenettes. This is incorrect.) Our only quibble would be staying in room three or maybe103, with our windows only a short distance away from a circular wall enclosing an exterior stairway. We would have much preferred some kind of a view. I would suggest that you request a room other than 103, 203, etc. We don't particularly like large breakfasts, so enjoyed local cafes. Try one of the excellent croissants at the cafe on the corner at the end of the block to your left, walking out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Tegia
Reviews.Content: Excellent breakfast, very reasonably priced, chic area (Knesebeckstrasse, Savignyplatz, Kantstrasse), excellent restaurants and cafes nearby, near S- and U-bahn, friendly reception- only drawback is the steps that have to be taken between room floors and elevator (located between each floor).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel indeed”
Reviews.Author: Stavanger_fam
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend! Stayed for 2 nights at this hotel togehter with a group of collegues from work. It is very nice with large rooms, tasteful decorations, friendly staff and a wonderful roof terrace at the 7th floor to enjoy the splendid breakfast or coffee with cakes (from 12-21 every day!) . I stayed in a comfort room which is huge with a separate dressingroom. Great value for money really. Located near the Ernst-Reuter platz underground station and in walking distance from Savignyplatz makes it a perfect base for exploration of Berlin and surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: RodHobart
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem and hard to go past. It is excellent value and recently refurbished. The owners have thought about all the little details that put a smile on your face. The location is excellent with good restaurants within minutes walk and close to the underground station and links to the airport. The service is excellent along with the breakfast. The room was a good size and although there no air conditioning a large fan kept the room comfortable in the hot weather. We would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Otto is good”
Reviews.Author: catlovers6199
Reviews.Content: I stayed in hotel Otto 3 nights. Big room, excellent breakfast, friendly staff. Lovely neighbourhood with restaurants and cafes nearby. 7th floor with complimentary coffee and cakes in the afternoon was lovely! Could not ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotl”
Reviews.Author: triphydie
Reviews.Content: Great location, lovely rooms, delicious breakfast, nice views, good service, good price. This hotel is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Very hip”
Reviews.Author: petraqrsq
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite unique. The rooms were very nice, and they all had a kitchenette. The staff was incredibly helpful and nice. The breakfast buffet was of the best I have seen in my life, and they had theme weeks (I was there during "fish week", and there was a wide choice of fish and seafood options, from hering to pawns). The best thing yet was that on the top floor they served free coffee and cake every day from noon to 9 pm. Just a 2 minute walk from U-Bahn Station Ernst-Reuter-Platz , 5 minutes from S-Bahn Station Savignyplatz, and very close to the center of West-Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but good”
Reviews.Author: Peanut-NL
Reviews.Content: Hotel Otto is just a block away from the subway in the quiet university district, which makes it a convenient base to explore Berlin. It's a no-frills hotel, without a formal restaurant or bar, but they serve a great breakfast on the 7th floor, which you can have either inside in the breakfast reastaurant or on their lovely (but small) balcony overlooking the city. Anti-allergic bedsheets and pillows available on request, which is a very nice service. Rooms are spacious and quiet, almost a suite as there is a small hallway that connects the bedroom and bathroom, and there's a seperate room with wardrobe. Good, free wifi. The safes in the room are not big enough to store a laptop. Not recommended for people who have troubles with stairs, as the elevator stops are at half-floors so you always have to go up or down some stairs to get to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel,feel like home”
Reviews.Author: MuslumDeniz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there with my kids and wife.You dont see any stuff around but when you need everybody is ready to help you.I liked the location and the room,also the service in the 7th floor.There are lots of chic rest. around the hotel.you can find and cusine you like.BEST LOCATION,BEST ROOM,BEST SERVICE,BEST STUFF.Best hotel for family and business.

Reviews.Title: “A very Stylish Hotel of Good Quality”
Reviews.Author: TheLondonGuy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Otto is rather stylish and looks like it was formerly an office rather than a hotel. It is located in a quite area although there are many good restaurants, of most nationalities, within walking distance. The hotel is about ten minutes walk from an S-Bahn station. This will get you to central Berlin within 15 minutes, without changing trains. The reception desk staff all spoke excellent English and were very helpful with regards to directions, restaurant recommendations and travel queries. The lift (which had a recording of birds singing inside) served alternative floors so often left a short flight of stairs to negotiate which could be tricky with very heavy luggage. Now let me say that I paid a very low rate for a ‘comfort’ double room (bigger than the standard rooms) which was like a mini-suite. I also got free breakfast every day (priced at $13 Euros per head) thanks to Tripadvisor. The room was one of the biggest that I have had anywhere. It had a very large bed, with memory foam mattress, a walk in wardrobe-room and large bathroom (with wet-room shower). There was a Juliette balcony with full length opening patio-style door. The room was very stylish and very clean. There was a TV and digital safe. Unfortunately, there were no tea and coffee making facilities, or fridge, but free bottled mineral water was provided. There was also a powerful floor-fan. Free wi-fi was also provided. It is important to note that I stayed in august during a very hot and humid spell. Fortunately my room was at the back of the hotel and out of the sun for much of the day, although it still got very hot. Air conditioning would have been a godsend. I really needed the fan and free water! Breakfast was served in a room on the top floor of the hotel. It has a small balcony with some outside seating. Breakfast was buffet-style, but of very good quality. All German food is expensive, so I doubt if you could have saved much if you took breakfast outside of the hotel. Once again the room was in desperate need of Air-con and seemed to suffer from a plague of wasps. The breakfast staff were charming. Tea and cakes are provided free each afternoon which is a nice touch although any self-respecting tourist would be pacing the streets of Berlin and would miss them. I was given free coffee when I arrived early to check in to my room (another nice touch). The Hotel does not have a bar or restaurant as such. Nearly all aspects of the hotel and it’s service were excellent, apart from the lack of Air-Con, fridge and a kettle. Of course if it was not the height of summer or you have a high tolerance to heat, these issues would not be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Hotel Otto!”
Reviews.Author: Deidre D
Reviews.Content: My daughter, my two grandsons and I stayed at the Hotel Otto for 3 nights in July 2011. We loved the hotel! I even received a room upgrade at no extra charge. The location was great, the breakfast was amazing. I would definitely stay here again. Wonderful hotel and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to explore Berlin from”
Reviews.Author: Teg94
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, the 7th Floor terrace with a great choice of drinks, cakes and fresh fruit is lovely to go back to after touring Berlin. The position of the hotel is within a short distance of an S-bahn and a U-bahn station. We purchased a Welcome Card that enables you to use the trains whenever you want so we could return to the hotel for a break and go back out again whenever we wished to. The staff at the hotel are very helpful and friendly. After visiting other parts of the city I think the area is a good area to stay with a good selection of pavement style restaurants

Reviews.Title: “for the perks, very affordable!”
Reviews.Author: abigailmara
Reviews.Content: We were traveling on a budget and we couldn't believe that Hotel Otto fit in our budget! we had a beautiful, modern room. We were on the first floor and unfortunatly it felt like we were right on the street, also there was no AC in the room so it made it very stuffy (if we opened the windows we'd be listening to everyone on the street all night.) Hotel Otto is in a high end, beautiful part of Berlin, close to the Ubahn and walking distance to major sites. Every afternoon you can enjoy the roof top of the hotel and have unlimited coffee, cakes and tea. A very nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Otto”
Reviews.Author: kellr
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin for four days and the Hotel Otto was a great place for a solo female traveler. The standard-sized room was a great size for me and the bathroom was lovely. The decor is very minimalist-modern. It was incredibly quiet even though it was on the first floor near the stairwell and elevator. The staff was friendly and super helpful, printing out directions and maps for me if I needed them. They sell public transportation tickets at the front desk which is more convenient than the Automat at the U-Bahn stations. The breakfast was absolutely lovely, and I even got it free with a voucher from Tripadvisor! Normally it's 13 euros (which is steep, but it's a really nice spread). The neighborhood is on the swankier side, with chic boutiques and restaurants. As a female I felt safe walking around the area. I would totally recommend this hotel for anyone traveling in Berlin, from solo travelers to couples. Oh, and free Wifi!! This is a huge perk in Europe, where free Wifi seems impossible to find.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Lex59
Reviews.Content: Well with the German reputation for being uptight I can say that is far from true. I lived there I have issues with Germans which I will not bring up here as it is not relevant but this hotel is where I stayed the day before I moved into my flat and also where I stayed years later coming to visit friends. Whilst the rooms are not large, they are amazing. Cleanliness, comfort and perfectionist is how I would describe them. I am ALL ABOUT THE ROOM. I do not go to a hotel for the lobby or restaurants or anything but to feel at home sleeping and showering and feel like I am not sleeping where 1000's of others have. They successfully achieve this!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price (but small)”
Reviews.Author: MezzaM
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel with some of the nicest hotel staff I have ever come across. We paid €70 a night so didn't expect too much but were pleasantly surprised. Good: great staff, great location (if a little quiet), good breakfast (included in the price), clean with all that you need Bad (ish): very small room (but we paid a very small price), no bath, very basic rooms. Overall we would go back if only for the fab service. Only given 4 stars because the size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: madtchr
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with a very large room for a double! Great bathroom and it had private parking included. No air condition but the staff provided us with a huge fan which worked out great. We arrived past the check-in time, but the front desk staff waited for us to arrive and even insisted on carrying our bags to our room. The hotel is located outside the main city center but it was only a 15 minute walk to the nearest metro. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, friendly, romantic”
Reviews.Author: DoritandDimitri
Reviews.Content: We read only positive comments about Otto Hotel and were ready to be disappointed. We weren't. We arrived at 11 p.m. but checkin was flawless. The staff... without fail was helpful and friendly at all times. The room was large and comfortable. There should have been another chair in the room, but we neglected to ask for it and there weren't enough hangers, also easily remedied. The bed was just right and the street was quiet. The hotel is located in Charlottenburg, an upscale area with lots of restaurants nearby. We'll gladly stay at the hotel again and will recommend it to our friends. It's a real 'find'.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: fholden
Reviews.Content: Great location, just 5mins walk from Savingyplatz or Ernst Reuter Platz stations. Very friendly and helpful staff. Beautiful room with plenty of space. Good value room rates. Breakfast on the top floor is well worth a visit even if it's not in your room rate. Fantastic selection of food and drinks. Plenty of eating options nearby, ranging from breakfast, lunch and dinner. Will stay here again when back in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: fltmazzola
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the studio and it was fantastic. Not only were the beds incredibly comfortable, but the kitchen was also fully equipped for cooking. The staff were also incredibly kind and helpful (one of our bags was lost by the airline and he kept us updated). It was wonderful. If you are going to Berlin, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Caring, clean, modern and immaculate”
Reviews.Author: innovationalist
Reviews.Content: The best hotel experience I have ever had. Fabulous studio room, the staff friendly, helpful and spoke English well. And the breakfast is outstanding, even bucks fizz to start the day. Thanks Hotel Otto, an outstanding experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Excellent Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: SW39
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Otto after seeing the reviews on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. For EUR 115, I had a huge room, with a comfortable double bed, a single bed in one corner, a walk-in wardrobe area, a decent-sized bathroom and large windows letting in plenty of light including a full-sized French Window that opened fully. The room's designed is essentially functional, but the light and the splashes of colour here and there made it a pleasant environment as well. As one would expect in Germany, everything was spotlessly clean and efficiently serviced. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful - I really appreciated the front desk's patience in explaining directions to various sights every morning. For me, what stood Hotel Otto above other hotels in this bracket were the numerous little touches intended to make guests feel welcome as well as cater to their convenience. For instance, I arrived two hours before check-in time but the front desk did not hesitate to try and give me access to my room as early as possible. I was told the room would be ready in 20 minutes and was invited to leave my bags at the desk while I relaxed in the lounge on the 7th floor. I decided to leave the bag and head straight out to do a bit of sight-seeing and when I returned several hours later, I was pleasantly surprised to find that my luggage had already been placed in my room.... Other nice touches included the specially-printed tour maps handed out at reception, the unlimited complimentary drinking water (either placed in the room or kept near the vending machine for guests to help themselves to), free wifi and the complimentary coffee and cakes available on the 7th floor all afternoon. The 7th floor lounge was large, spacious, airy and full of light. As well as plenty of seating inside, a balcony terrace was also available to dine at. I had a free breakfast voucher so don't know how much the morning meal cost, but it certainly seemed like more value-for-money fare: the buffet was laden with a large selection of cereals, patisserie, bread, cheeses, cold cuts, salads, vegetables, fruit, yoghurt, jams and spreads as well as hot eggs, bacon and sausages. Another lovely little touch was the bottle of chilled bubbly included along with the juices, water, tea and coffee. The hotel does not offer room service but a well-stocked vending machine dispensed snacks, sweets and drinks. The vending machine accepted notes as well as coins and provided change. On the downside, I did not notice an air-conditioner in my room. This was fine by me because the weather needed no more than the pedestal fan provided in my room (especially with the windows open) but I wonder if this might pose more of an issue during the height of summer... Finally, a little about the hotel's location on Knesebeckstrasse near Savignyplatz in the Charlottenburg area. This was a lovely, residential area - quiet and peaceful, with plenty of bars, cafes and restaurants, an S-Bahn station (Savignyplatz) and an abundance of greenery, especially around Savignyplatz. The neighbourhood felt safe at all times and I found the residents to be friendly, polite and helpful - one lady even offered me an extra brunch voucher she had as I sat down next to her table at the Bond restaurant. The area was a good example of one aspect of the Berlin personality: the amiable, easy-going, cafe-culture one. With the sun making brave attempts to best the clouds, it was very pleasant indeed to sit at an outdoor table (practically every single restaurant in the area seemed to have outside seating) with a Schwartzbier and a cigar... Nearby restaurants I would recommend: Mar-y-Sol at the bottom of Knesebeckstrasse (just by Savignyplatz) for superlative tapas, Cafe Brel around Savignyplatz for authentic French bistro fare and Der Kuchenladen at 138 Kantsrasse for an indulgent mid-afternoon cupcake and coffee. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Hotel Otto and would not hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, needs air con!”
Reviews.Author: needtotravelmoreUk
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, super friendly staff on hand! They do need air con and a mini bar in the room. Near the tube 24 tube line so good for those late nights out in East Berlin! Great shower! Reception is not 24hr but they do provide a front door key! Oh and the beds are extremely comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price, spacious room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tyst
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights.Hotel Otto can not be considered as a really boutique hotel. Given the price you pay and the space you use in the room, it really can be a very good choice. Although situated in west Berlin, it is close to U bahn and S bahn stations,which means the transportation is not a big problem. Not only that, the neighborhood is full of many reasonable priced restaurants of various cuisines,which is an excellent advantage.Also worth mentioning is the buffet breakfast is really nice, might beat many 4 star hotels. A few drawbacks of Otto are that they don't have 24 hour reception, and no air con and mini bar in the room. I do suggest the owner put air con in the room, because sometimes it can be hot.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel For Berlin sight seeing.”
Reviews.Author: BobandMaggie60
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. The location is perfect, lots of lovely restaurants and shops close by, but with easy transport links to other parts of Berlin. Modern, sophisticated boutique type hotel in a great location of Charlottenberg. Friendly & helpful staff. Mostly very quiet in and around the hotel. Clean, stylish & spacious rooms. The area is quiet and leafy but comes to life a little at night, with a very good variety of restaurants of all types from Vietnamese and Spanish to French, Italian and Syrian and the hotel staff will provide a list of recommended places to eat if you ask. Breakfast is superb, a large spread of fruit, yogurt, cereals, bread, meat, fish, cheese, hot egg dishes and pancakes as well as pastries. During our 4 night stay there was also an asparagus theme for 3 of the days and cheese for another which provided extra special dishes with these as the main ingredient. Fresh coffee is available at breakfast time including cappuccinos and there is even sparkling wine!.We were lucky to have good weather so could sit on the terrace for our breakfast. We also enjoyed the free tea,coffee, fruit juices and cakes in the afternoons during our stay whenever we made it back to the hotel before 7pm. We bought Berlin cards at the airport for our 5 day visit and used trains and buses mainly. The100 and 200 buses from Zoogarten a short walk away from the hotel were ideal for sight seeing and very frequent. The card also allows discounts for admissions to some places of interest. Our only disappointment of the holiday was not being able to go inside the Reicshstag...You can only tour the inside if you have booked online 2 or 3 days beforehand.... Otherwise...Berlin is a great city to visit..... I would definitely stay in this excellent hotel again and will also recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant, relaxing, hotel”
Reviews.Author: fedupchoosingname
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Otto for 3 nights at the end of May. Our room - a comfort room - was large and airy. The hotel and surrounding area were quiet. Breakfast was excellent - a copious buffet with plenty of choice. The opportunity to have afternoon coffee and cakes is a nice added touch. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. They provided travel advice and maps. We were also able to buy public transport tickets from reception. Were there any downsides? Not really. There is no air conditioning so that could be a problem in very hot weather. That said when we were there the temperature was over 30 centigrade during the day and we were able to sleep perfectly well at night with the windows open. There is also only one lift mid-way between flights of stairs going to each floor. Again this was not a problem for us but could be difficult for others. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, and would go back to Hotel Otto when we next have the opportunity to visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: caroline456
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on its location and the photos of the breakfast I had seen on Tripadvisor. I was not disappointed. The location is perfect, lots of lovely restaurants and shops close by, but with easy transport links to other parts of Berlin. Breakfast is superb, a large spread of fruit, yogurt, bread, meat, cheese and pastries. There is even sparling wine! We loved the tea and coffee that is provided free of charge in the afternoons, and made use of it on both days of our stay. We were lucky to have good weather and so could sit out on the terrace for breakfast. Prior to staying at Hotel Otto, I had been staying at Andels Hotel and out of the two, the location of Hotel Otto is far superior. The rooms at Hotel Otto are smaller, as you may expect for an older building, and there is no pool, but Hotel Otto offers free wifi, which the other hotel does not. For a leisure break I much prefer the location of Hotel Otto and would certainly stay there again if I return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in great location close to restaurants and bars”
Reviews.Author: AnneKelly
Reviews.Content: We purchased a 48 hour travel pass from reception at Hotel and made great use of the No 100 bus round Berlin - join it opposite the Zoo Garden Station. Such an efficient service! Staff gave excellent advice. We had breakfast on the terrace every morning and listened to the birds singing - lovely relaxed atmosphere for a city Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in the crown that is Charlottenburg”
Reviews.Author: jazzfool
Reviews.Content: Modern, sophisticated boutique type hotel in a great location in Charlottenberg. Friendly & helpful staff. Very quiet in and around the hotel. Clean, stylish & spacious rooms, with adjoining dressing rooms in the 'comfort' suites. The area is quiet and leafy but comes to life a little at night, with good restaurants of all types from indian vegetarian cafe style places to reasonably up-market french and italian eateries. There are numerous small book, antique and craft shops in the direct vicinity. Very convenient for the shops on Kurfurstendamm and the Sunday flea market at the west side of the Tiergarten. S-Bahn, U-Bahn and city bus connections are only a few minute stroll away in a couple of directions with the main hub being at Zoolog Garten, from where Alexanderplatz is a mere 20 minute bus journey. Alternatively, an hour or so strolling through the Tiergarten will get you very nicely to the Brandenburg Gate. I would definitely stay in this hotel again and would also recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL - GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: KATIA-GEORGE
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Berlin where we stayed at Otto hotel. It is a great hotel, in a great area with very helpful and friendly staff. The breakfast was very good as well. My children loved the small presents (block and pencils) they received on our last day. No compaints at all. We are looking forward to coming back. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay at Otto in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Steve_n_Angela
Reviews.Content: We took a trip to Berlin at Easter 2011, booking the Otto after reading Tripadvisor reviews, pictures etc. We were very pleased with the outcome; a very nice and friendly hotel, the comfort rooms more than catered for the four of us, mostly for sleeping and unwinding after travels around berlin. Staff are very friendly and helpful, to extent of having corkscrew, umbrellas when it thundered one night, hints at which restaurants to use - try Pasta n Basta across the road- and there is complimentary tea/coffee available in the top floor lounge area. Rooms are very clean, beds so comfortable, a seperate dressing area/walk in wardrobe was very useful; most certainly recommended and would use again. For trips to berlin itself, the transport system is excellent - plan where you want to go and use S-bahn and U-bahn, use family or multi day tickets, save money on the standard tour bus unless you need a long not so interesting commentary trip. Most guid e books and locations can give sufficient info.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Robin655
Reviews.Content: I don’t normally write reviews, but feel I have to for this Hotel because it was so good. My wife and I and our 16 year old son stayed at the Hotel Otto for a short midweek break in Berlin. On arrival the reception staff were exceptionally helpful. Alongside all the usual information about the Hotel, they provided us with an excellent map of the City and some tips on the best places to visit, particularly mentioning things a teenager would enjoy. Their high level of courtesy and help never faltered during our stay. We left a camera in the room on our departure. They contacted us by both phone and email and posted it on to us at home. The rooms were really stylishly furnished, very spacious and comfortable and exceptionally clean. The breakfast buffet is fantastic – a truly superb variety of top quality food. The Hotel’s location is very good – there are some really great reasonably priced restaurants within staggering distance, and a Ubahn station and bus stops within about 250m, so its very easy to get to the main sites very quickly. But the things that really made the difference were the free little extras like bottles of mineral water in the rooms that get replenished and cakes and coffee in the breakfast room during the afternoon. I felt that all the staff were really passionate about making our stay a really great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OTTO suited all our needs beautifully.”
Reviews.Author: MsManagement1326
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a great trip to Berlin and a four night stay at the Hotel OTTO. We had a standard room which was plenty big enough (we've had much smaller European hotel rooms) with stylish furnishings. The large closet was nice as it held clothes, suitcases, & clutter adequatley and out of the room itself. The shower had the best water pressure I've ever experienced, I only wish I had that at home! Our room faced the back and was next to the stairwell & elevator; it was very quiet the first 2 nights but less so the last 2 as someone with a heavy foot liked taking the stairs. This being said it was a minor disturbance to us but if you crave absolute quiet you might want to request a room away from the stairs. I had booked the Hotel Otto partly because the breakfast & afternoon cake sounded so good but we ended up being too busy to have either. Maybe next time! And the location was great for public transit to everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base to Explore”
Reviews.Author: Gcancello
Reviews.Content: A wonderful base to explore the amazing city of Berlin. The hotel is a two minute walk from the train station where a one stop journey takes you to the Zoo where you can pick up one of several city bus tours. The rooms are well appointed, comfy beds, small but tidy bathroom and enough storage space for 2. The staff at the hotel are amazing, they will give directions to sites, recommend resturants, and help in whatever way they can. They also provide a local map which is very useful. After a long days site seeing the complimentary afternoon tea is just what you need. In the breakfast bar with roof garden a wide range of teas, coffees and juices are available with fruits, cakes and the like. I was only in the wonderful city of Berlin 3 days and didnt see anywhere near all of it so when I return it will almost certainly be to the Otto. A taxi from the airport cost around E15.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant hotel in a fab location”
Reviews.Author: MuppetLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Berlin where we stayed at Hotel Otto for 4 nights. The hotel is in a lovely part of Berlin and about 5 mins from the nearest S train station so really easy to get around. The room was lovely - very spacious and the free fruit and water was a nice touch with free bottled water available from reception during our stay. The roof top terrace for breakfast was great and the breakfast itself really good value with lots to choose from. free coffee and cake to hotel guests throughout the day which is a lovely touch. The staff were brilliant - all spoke perfect English (thank you!) and were always really helpful whether making hotel reservations or giving us directions. We would definitely stay here again if we return to this great city and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to friends. It's spotless and really good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality Hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: daffodill12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Otto during February and March 2011 for my birthday. We booked a comfort room, so a slight upgrade from the standard room. The rooms were uber modern, decorated and furnished to a very high standard. The beds were very comfy and the walk in wardrobe was great as we could dump all our stuff out of the way. Check in for the hotel was easy and strightforward the and reception staff were welcoming. There was a free map and some good information provided in the room. We had breakfast included in the price, and it was very handy to be able to eat and then go. The breakfast consisted of croissants, cakes, hot buffet, fruit, youghurt, meats and cheeses and plenty of differnt drink. The hotel had free cakes and drinks aswell during the afternoon and into the evening, and again it was nice to go and relax after a hard day walking round the city. Whilst the hotel says it is only a few steps away from the Ubahn and S bahn station in reality its 10 minutes walk from the S Bahn station, but only a few minutes walk from the U Bahn station. As such I would recommend on arrival coming into city with bags you use the U Bahn station (recommended by the hotel on their own website info). When you come out of the U Bahn station if you look for the renaissance theatre on the corner the hotel is on the same street. We arrived in the dark and spent ages trying to work out how to get to the hotel. In the street where the hotel is there are lots of different restaurants where you can eat. If you want bars and a slightly busier night out I would suggest coming out of the hotel, walking left, then at the end of the street walking right (or catching the U Bahn and getting off at Zoo Garden) If you walk 15 minutes down that road you get to the ZOO Garden stations and in that area you will find a cheap supermarket, McDonalds, Burger King , Pizza Hut and a Euro Centre where there is an Irish Pub and a KFC. From here you can also walk to famous Kurfersdamm shopping area. Overall this hotel is a great base from which to explore the city, its in a peaceful location so allows you to catch up on some much needed zzzzzzzzzzzzzzz's after a long day in the city. Whilst the majority of the history is in East Berlin, this is only a short ride away by U or S Bahn and being in West Berlin was a nice base from which to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Classy hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: seenfromafar
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find fault with this place. I think I was lucky as I was allocated a nice room on the top floor with a Juliet balcony overlooking the quiet street at the front. I had a fridge, microwave and a coffee maker (without supplies) in my room, so I could cater for myself if I needed to. But everyone gets the fabulous breakfast buffet, and free coffee and cake during the afternoon. There are good places to eat and drink on the same street, as well as some nice distinctive shops. The shops and restaurants of Ku'Damm are within easy walking distance, as is Charlottenburg Palace - definitely worth a visit if you've time. And, of course, the rest of wonderful Berlin is easily accessible by public transport from both ends of the street...

Reviews.Title: “Very hip, very comfortable in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: travelingdoc11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was probably one of my favorites during my three week business/vacation trip to Europe. Very friendly and courteous staff, super clean rooms, very spacious, very modern. I loved the breakfast room upstairs on the 7th floor. They keep pastries, coffee/tea, juices, water, and fruit in the breakfast room all day for anyone who wants a snack. Nice view, as well. We will definitely be coming back to this hotel on our next trip. Downside...lots of stairs. I was traveling with my elderly parents and it was hard for them to get to the 7th floor. There is a lift, but you still have to walk up steps to get to it. Cute touch...bird sounds in the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Staff very helpful!!! Tea and Coffee and Cakes available free most of the day!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jen_Travel52
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving, I felt a little disappointed re the "Foyer" etc, However it turned out to be a perfect room with a little Opening Door onto the street below and a great "Walk-in robe/dressing room". The location is perfect as it is only about a 3-4 minute walk from "Ernst Reuter Platz" station (as well as from the Airport Bus Stop). There are lots of restaurants near by and I felt vey safe walking around at any time of the day or night. The Hotel has Free "tea, coffee and Pastries and Cakes" from about 2pm until about 10 pm at night in their restaurant which was amazing!!!!.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Haylow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Otto for 3 nights in mid December. The hotel is in Knesebeckstrasse, a road which has a number of good restaurants and bars, but outside of the centre, so uncrowded and quiet. We ate at Aida, one of the Italian restaurants as it was very reasonable and always full (which we take as a good sign). The reception staff were very efficient and helpful. They explained the area and gave some recommendations on the best Christmas markets to visit (they were spot on). We were shown to our room which was huge. There was even a separate 'corridor' to hang coats, leave boots etc. Beds were comfortable. Our room was facing the main street, but it was quiet and didn't keep us awake. We paid for the buffet breakfast in our inclusive rates, and it was worth it. The selection would please most people and included things such as smoked salmon, scrambled eggs, croissants, ham and cheese etc etc. Breakfast runs from 7 am to 12 pm - suitable for early wakers and late sleepers. The hotel also offered coffee and cakes from 2 pm to 9 pm. There is free wifi, and you are given a password which lasts for 24 hours. If you turn left out of the hotel you are about a 1 min walk away from the underground - one stop away from the Berlin Zoo station so a good line. We don't normally stay right in the centre of things, and this was as good as it gets for location. I would highly recommend this hotel. One thing I would say is that they have a lot of coach parties staying, so check this out the night before with reception and if there is a coach party, treat yourself to a lie in and go to breakfast later, otherwise it's a scramble for food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, friendly staff, nice room”
Reviews.Author: FatBoyTravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last weekend and found it just right for a base to see Berlin. The staff were very friendly and attentive providing maps and tips for things to do and see and places to eat. Easy walk to either Underground or S Bahn stations and you can buy tickets at reception. Nice location with plenty of different types and price ranges of bars/restaurants within easy walking distance in a very safe area. No bar/restaurant on site but a cafe/lounge area on the top floor serving a very good German style brekfast selection (13:00 Euro pp) and complimentary coffee and cakes form 12:00 until late.

Reviews.Title: “RECOMMENDED!”
Reviews.Author: NorwayKath
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, direct bus X9 from Tegel to Ernst Reuter Platz. Nice restaurants very close to the hotel, we tried Pasta&Basta and Ciao Italia, both very good. Large rooms by European standards. Our room easily accomodated four people with the extra bed put in. Loved the walkin closet- with a window! It was the details that made the stay special. Very serviceminded staff. The excellent breakfast buffet in the lounge on 7th floor had lovely food, always delicate and fresh. Free coffe and cake all day long. The misteltoe they put up in the breakfast room. The fresh flowers on each table. And on our last morning there were large chocolate Santas next to every couvert! Child friendly in all means. Except that the elevators were on "half-floors", which meant that my husband had to carry the baby stroller a few steps each time we came or left. (Same problem at this particual u-bahn station, actually.) But we would choose this hotel again for our next trip to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: cr7London
Reviews.Content: Booked via an online site and was very good value. I didn't take the breakfast as it was a bit pricy and there are places just up the street on the way to the metro if all you need is a juice/coffee and something to nibble . Staff helpful and friendly. Free internet/water in the rooms and free tea/cakes in the afternoon. Great eating places close by. Comfortable rooms, no frills in the reception area - but who needs them. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: TheChadi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located within Charlottenburg. The staff are incredible and the room was of good size for me. The room was very elegantly designed and kept clean at all times. The bathroom was very clean and roomy as well. I don't have anything against the hotel, the location and sleep quality were excellent. There are plenty of restaurants in the neighborhood and public transportation is a very short stroll away. Kurfürstendamm is just a couple of minutes walk away with all its shopping for those interested in that. I tried to book the hotel several times afterwards but was always full during my visits to the city. Try to book it in advance to get a place there.

Reviews.Title: “Best base in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ulrikamebius
Reviews.Content: I found hotel Otto on TripAdvisor and we stayed there for 3 nights. We had the Family Package which included 3 nights, breakfast, free carparking (since we arrived by car really good), tickets for the U and S bahn and even packed lunch two days if we wanted. We stayed in a comfort room on the 4th floor which was really big and very clean. Good beds with nice and fluffy beddings. Free internet during our stay. The situation of the hotel is perfect in a calm surrounding ( good when you have children and just whant to go out and eat) with a lot of good restaurants and close to the Ubahn. The breakfast was a real treat and we did not miss a thing!! The car was safely parked in the hotel's backyard. Hotel Otto is a real bargin and a bliss! The lounge with the view over Berlin is really nice. But best of all is the friendly staff!! When we arrived we got a whole package with information about restaurant and things to do. We tried several of the restaurants suggested in the surrondings and they were really good and classy. We had a very nice stay and I have already recommended the OTTO to some friends and we will be back next time we head for Berlin. The only thing I can complain about is the lobby which is a bit dull.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for what is is...”
Reviews.Author: JuliefromBrussels
Reviews.Content: After reading all these positive reviews I booked a standard room for 2 nights. We paid 190€ excl breakfast so our expectations were high. The neighbourhood (charlottenburg) is very nice and the location of the hotel is good but we were very dissapointed about the size of the room and the overal hotel ammenities. We had a noisy room on the 1st floor, the smallest bath room I've ever seen in my live and twin beds despite asking for a double bed. I think there are better options to stay in Berlin...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & facilities, great location”
Reviews.Author: AberdeenClare
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Otto for 5 nights on holiday. We arrived in Berlin (Tegel Airport) and got a taxi to the hotel (around 20 Euros if I remember correctly). The reception was open until 11 pm so not a problem for evening flights. Our room was immaculate - both the bedroom and the bathroom spotlessly clean, as were the communal areas of the hotel (lift, corridors, restaurant). We had requested a quiet, comfort room, and were given room 505, overlooking the car park at the back of the hotel. It was indeed quiet and we heard no noise at all from neighbours during the nights that we were there. Our only complaint was that despite being a comfort room it did not have the day bed and dressing room as advertised - however, the staff agreed a suitable compromise. The location of the hotel was good. It's in a wide, quiet street, and the areas that we frequented in the evening felt very safe for walking around. I would have no problem in recommending this hotel to a lone female traveller. There were plenty of restaurants within walking distance. We often ended up in what I recall was Cafe Hardenberg, left out of the hotel and then right and along the road on the right hand side, where the drinks were very reasonably priced, coffees and teas were available all evening, and staff were friendly. Within the hotel, we very much enjoyed the high quality breakfast. A huge range of options included the usual continental cereals, juices, fruits and yogurts, and there was also a range of cheese, cold meats, smoked salmon etc. A delicious, high quality spread every day, with a relaxed and friendly atmosphere where you could linger as long as you wished. Coffee, tea and cake were available in the afternoons, although we did find that the coffee was starting to get cold in the early evenings. The best time to strike would be late afternoon. Contrary to other reviews, we never arrived to find the cake finished. We also really appreciated the free bottled water (available from reception). These were nice touches. Reception staff were friendly and helpful. We were able to purchase bus tickets which we used to travel to the East, and enjoyed seeing the sights of Checkpoint Charlie and the Museum there. All in all, an excellent hotel which is well worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location for laid back Berlin trip”
Reviews.Author: Alex_PL
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and everything that we read is at it should be: it is located in a charming street with low traffic, wide sidewalks and plenty of restaurants to choose from (we particularly recommend visiting: Pratirio-Cypriot/Greek and Buddha Republic-Indian/Asian). Knesebeckstrasse is also a short walk from KuDam and there are both U-Bahn and S-Banh on both ends of the street. One minor disappointment was that the Comfort room that we booked was about half the size of what is described on the hotel web site (approx. 16-18sqm vs. 36sqm) and it was the smallest room on the floor based on the emergency map.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience, I will definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: Eleo_2010
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing stay at Hotel OTTO. Starting from the friendly reception up to the perfect location! Highly recommended, comfortable, clear rooms and fantastic breakfast. Friendly staff (I will not forget my favourite tea!), convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: drkenbuck
Reviews.Content: Set in the leafy area of Charlottensburg, this trendy hotel was roomy and the staff delightful. Transportation to the old East Berlin was simple by train although the walk via the gardens was worthwhile doing once, at least. Restaurants in the hotel area are plentiful and varied.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Travelkuri
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Otto in August 2010 after reading the excellent reviews on trip advisor. My stay at Hotel Otto Berlin for 3 nights was in a comfort room. The room was bigger than I expected and there was even a luggage room as part of the room. The hotel staff were friendly and always helpful especially when I asked about recommendations about eating at local restaurants. The location is great. Charlottenburg is a lovely part of Berlin. I especially liked the roof terrace at the top of the hotel. I would highly recommend a stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Charlottenburg”
Reviews.Author: windy1875
Reviews.Content: Having as always used Tripadviser to work out the best place to stay we opted for hotel Otto and this turned out to be a great choice. As other reviews have stated its a great area with lots of resturants and the area has a great vibe. The hotel room is very hot at night and you do need to open the window or put on the fan but its no hardship to do this. Hotel very clean and liked the set up of the rooms and staff happy to help. All in all a great stay and this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Comfort, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bm73
Reviews.Content: Hotel Otto is very centrally located in Berlin. The underground (U2) is just around the corner. There is also a taxi stand just around the corner – with a line of waiting taxis day & night. There are lots of restaurants and smaller shops throughout the entire hotel neighborhood. The reception personnel were very friendly and helpful. The front door is locked / reception is closed from 8:00 p.m. until early morning (I am not sure how they handle late arrivals). You need your room key to open the front door in the evenings. During the day small cakes, coffee, tea, water and juice is offered (free-of-charge) to all guests at the 7th floor dining area. Breakfast is from 7:00 a.m. until noon. Breakfast costs 13 Euro per person. It is well worth it. Lots of fresh fruit, juice, muesli, bread, pastries, eggs, sausages, etc. All common areas in the hotel are clean and tidy. Our room was very spacious. Everything in the room was very clean (bathroom, sheets – spotless). There was even a walk-in wardrobe. Hairdryer, soap, hand cream, shampoo, etc. is available in the room The hotel offers you unlimited bottled water. A bottle is placed in your room upon arrival. Simply go to the reception to get a new one once it is empty. Free internet is available. Ask for it at the reception. You will need a user name and password. The pass is valid for 24 hours of internet usage. If you need more, simply get a new pass from the reception. The television in the room was very small. However, Berlin offers a great night life. The rooms are very quite. We didn’t hear any noise (or neighbors) during the day and at night. There are no balconies in the rooms (there is a balcony – where you can sit outside – on the 7th floor dining area). There is a small safe in the room. I can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: Irene_7770
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel! Highly recommended, comfortable, clear rooms and fantastic breakfast. Friendly staff, convenient location.. a very nice place to stay if you visit Berlin. If only the treated mineral water was a litlle bit cooler, it would be just perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with the Best Staff I Have Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: travelrider
Reviews.Content: I have travelled far and wide over the years. I have travelled for pleasure and for business. I have stayed in the most plush of the luxury hotels and in backpackers digs as well. But, I have never stayed in a hotel which has as friendly and helpful a staff as Hotel Otto in Berlin. The hotel has great location and great rooms - no doubt, but its staff takes the cake. And this is true for each and every member of the staff at the reception. All of them go out of their way to advise you on sights and attractions. They always seem to be patient, relaxed and happy. Now coming to the room - I booked a single room, but was given a great double room - I was told that all rooms are at least as big - the only difference is in the rate (for single use it is cheaper!). The decor and style is minimalist, but very comfortable. I really appreciated the unlimited free bottles of water - a rarity in Europe. The location is great for people who want to use public transportation - the hotel is strategically situated almost midway between a U Bahn and a S Bahn stop. The neighbourhood is quiet with some very good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal stay in West Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Venti_caratteruzzi
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a beautiful west Berlin street (Charlottenburg). Less than 5 minutes from "U-" and "S-bahn" stations (Ernst Reuter Platz and Savigny Platz). Large rooms (we stay in a "confort room" at 5th floor) with sofa and a separate wardrobe, big windows on the street but very silent. The hotel staff is very kind and polite. Pro: great breakfast from 7 am to 12 pm (!); free internet wi-fi; complimentary bottles of water every day; complimentary coffees and cakes in the breakfast room from 2pm to 9 pm; parking; the website is cool and very informative. Con: no air conditioned (but this is a minor fault in a north european town)

Reviews.Title: “Good priced, convenient and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharklet
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading recommendations on the Trip Advisor site and was not disappointed. This hotel is great for a short break to discover Berlin, it is in one of the loveliest parts of Berlin, great for local restaurants/bars and easy if you want to travel around the city. The breakfast was great too. Good value for money and lovely room although we did have a comfort room which is one of the larger ones. Only things I would make you aware of is that there is no lounge area or bar so its your room or a bar over the road and do watch out if you are arriving late to the hotel as it was touch and go whether we got our room - reception is shut from 11pm and doors locked! We only made it as our suitcase was first off the plane otherwise would have been sleeping on the streets. I had emailed the hotel to say we would be late and they sent me a code to key in and my room keys were supposed to drop down into a tray, however for some reason this did not work and was quite a stressful start to the holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SunnyIsrael
Reviews.Content: I visited Berlin with my Parents and brother, and we booked a room for 4 people. From the very first moment it was perfect. Before we arrived to Germany I called the hotel to ask for a quiet room, and later on sent an email, asking about wi-fi (which they have for free! working excellent). On these two occasion I've got a professional and super-warm response from Mr. Schuck. Then, when we got to the hotel, the extremely beautiful Melanie checked us in. She was super-friendly and unbelievebly helpful, and spoke fluent English. We LOVED her! Others workers were wonderful and helpful as well - Alissa and another young woman. We also me tthe manager on the last day - he was also extremely nice! Next was the room - it was huge, clean and very comfortable (and we are 4 adults). The design is simple, minimalistic and soooooo pleasant. Beautiful colors, just gorgeos. Also, you can get as many bottles of mineral watter as you wish, for free. About noise - we haven't heard the slightest sound, the room was perfectly quiet. There are not enough words to describe breakfast. It was the best breakfast we'd ever had! The buffe tis so ruch, so fresh, so tastey... You need to taste it in order to understand! Also, 14:00-21:00 you can get tea, coffee and cakes for free in the dining room. Yammi! I do think the room needs another lightbulb or two, and also - the hotel is a bit far by foot from attractions, by we knew it and still chose to book it and overall Hotel Otto was just perfect. NO DOUBT we will book it again! SUPER RECOMMENDED, don't think twice!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: NewRadio
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week and I can thoroughly recommend the hotel. We arrived early as the only flight we could get was either early or late, and ended up being 3 hours early for check-in. The very helpful lady at the desk found a different room that was ready and let us check in early which was very much appreciated! She also went through the area briefly and asked about what we were looking to do and advised on where to go etc. The room we stayed in (a 'comfort' room) was very spacious for 2 people with VERY comfortable beds. It was clean and tidy with a modern bathroom and changing room/storage. I can;t comment on the breakfast as we didn't have it - it seemed a bit expensive at 13 Euro each so went out for breakfast every day (much cheaper!). The free coffee and cake each day was a nice touch as well. The location is fantastic as it's only 5 minutes to the nearest S-Bahn station (Savignyplatz) and there are lots of places nearby to go for lunch or dinner. It's also not too far to walk into different areas. All in all, it was exactly what we were looking for - friendly, clean and close to transport/restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, inexpensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: Drew F
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Otto for three nights in January 2010 and really enjoyed my stay. I arrived later in the evening after dragging my bag through the snow from the S-Bahn station (which is a short walk away) and was greeted by a lovely receptionist who informed me all about the hotel and things to do in Berlin. The lady was also very kind to speak in slow German for me rather than just speaking English, which I was very appreciative of.
