Conveniently located near restaurants, supermarkets, the S-Bahn and U-Bahn stations. Free Wi-Fi was a great asset and I took advantage of it many times. The bathroom was modern, although there were a couple of heating pipes running alongside the wall which were great to warm up with however I did burn myself a few times by accidentally leaning on them. The bed was comfortable but as it was composed of two single beds pushed together I was unable to stretch out due to a reasonable gap separating them. Over the first two nights I was distracted upon laying down to bed by a 'popping' sound which resembled dripping water. It wasn't until the second night that I realised it was the plastic covering of the lights behind the bed (which are visually appealing) cooling down. So on the third night I was conscious not to turn on those lights and was able to get to sleep much sooner. A wonderful hotel conveniently located with helpful staff. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice area”
Reviews.Author: HeidiNYC
Reviews.Content: Hotel is modern and the rooms are very spacious. It's also in a nice area, close to Cafe's, Shops, Yoga Studio and an S-Bahn Station not too far. Building itself is 50's style and the entrance is not a place to meet and stay, but the rooms make up for it. Internet connection was fast - a big plus! A good choice for the price, will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozmoz1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for a week. This reception was very kind and helpful. The standard rooms are good sized and modern decorated. The bathroom only has a shower but again everything is modern and new. The bed and pillows are also very comfortable. The only negative thing was that twice I found a very long woman's hair on my towel. Breakfast buffet was incredible. Everything you can wish for and more was available. Also, from 14-21, you can visit 7th floor for cakes, coffee and tea. I also enjoyed a large selection of teas available. The location is also wonderful with S-Bahn and U-Bahn stations close by. There is even a pharmacy just around the corner. Overall, I strongly recommend this hotel to whoever visiting Berlin for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, nice studio room, great location”
Reviews.Author: ExpatTraveller10
Reviews.Content: Modern style hotel, all staff from reception to breakfast were very friendly, kind and welcoming. Studio room was spacious for four. Enjoyed the delicious buffet breakfast, especially the late one on New Year's Day. Nice touch the hot/cold drinks and cake from 15:00 to 21:00 each day.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable “city prices”, come again!”
Reviews.Author: FredvdFlier
Reviews.Content: This hotel was verry nice!! Like other reviewers, I pick a hotel based on reviews from this website. I was not disappointed at all. The rooms were clean and spacious. The breakfast buffet was excellent.(inc.room price) Every week an onther food theme! Fresch, Rapid kind supplement!. We stayed for 4 nights and loved it. We'd stay there again in a heart beat. The neighborhood is very nice and the proximity to both the U bahn and the S bahn was convenient. It is a very nice neighborhood, with verry good restauarants. We celebrate “silvester” in Berlin. And the hotel have an late breakfast, tiil 15.00 ours!! Oke, nice friendly staff, good location. And reasonable “city prices”, come again!

Reviews.Title: “Near perfect”
Reviews.Author: Calvita
Reviews.Content: stayed in the otto last january and was very impressed with the hotel, location and our room. we were upgraded to the suite on the seventh floor and had a lovely private terrace overlooking berlin rooftops. the neighbourhood was lovely with a good bakery and restaurants a couple of steps away. the only thing was that we had to carry our baby buggy up a flight of stairs to reach our room as the lift didnt operate to the top, but in no way would this put me off staying here again and would recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed comfortable and friendly stay”
Reviews.Author: Inekek
Reviews.Content: The hotel otto was a very pleasant hotel , the rooms were clean and modern decorated although cosy. The breakfastroom was was also very nicely situated on the top floor with a very lovely view on Berlin. Breakfast itself was very good, all the foods you could want and in abundance.But most important ; staff was very friendly and enthusiast, i would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice!”
Reviews.Author: liljuhvit
Reviews.Content: The "Otto" is definitely the nicest hotel I've stayed in in Berlin so far. The location is fabulous, more than convenient for trips around the city, and the surrounding neighbourhood is quite charming. Staff was very friendly. Our room was small, but comfy, and definitely nicely designed. The bathroom could have been a tiny bit cleaner (corners were a bit dusty), but that's about all there is to complain about... Breakfast was good. There is free wi-fi and free coffee, tea, and cake in the afternoons (unfortunately, we didn't have the time to try the latter).

Reviews.Title: “Roomy rooms, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatriinaFinn
Reviews.Content: It was easy to get to the hotel from Tegel airport (bus X9). Room was excellent and roomy even though we had extra beds for two children. Service were friendly, although when we bought Berlin welcome cards from hotel, they sold us wrong tickets (should been ABC, valid for one adult and up to 3 children), not just AB. With these tickets we did not received any disscounts for child (other was under three years) and have not valid tickets for him in U-bahn. Late check-out was easily arranged, but day before check-out we were promised a extra price, but was normal price (50€) when checking out next afternoon. Location was Ok, but travelling with two young children, the attractions (Lego center, Loxx, Aquadom) were not near the hotel. It was easy to get those places with U-bahn, but took quite a long time (for the children). Breakfast was great; we did not get bored with that during our 3 night stay. Although it is a little expensive, we think it was worth it. In the elevator, there was a surprise, which were the most fun for the children.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: avinklr
Reviews.Content: they have a pleasant/helpful front desk, rooms are clean, warm and comfortable. Complimentary Breakfast is awesome and has different themes, the hotel is located close to both the underground rail and the surface train station. Moreover, they provide free spring water!!!!! complimentary tea with dessert in the evening!!!! one of the best value for money hotels i have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Simply an excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: evafoi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated only 5 min from two undergroundstations, in the heart of Charlottenburg, only one stop away from Bahnhof Zoo and the Deutsche Oper, in 10 min walking distance to the Gedächtniskirche. The breakfastbuffet is simply overwhelming, fresh and tasty. It is a happening in the morning! The stuff is just excellent, very professional and very friendly. The rooms are stylish, functional and very comfortable. It is very good value for money! After leaving Berlin it is clear that I will bring the next time I come to Berlin my close friends or family again here.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Otto”
Reviews.Author: giandelso
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in Berlin downtown. Warm reception and good service. Will come back again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Don't miss it!”
Reviews.Author: Niclas_Lund_Sweden
Reviews.Content: This is simply an excellent hotel. It beats me why it is only classified as a four-star hotel. The service is impeccable. The rooms are very spacious and well-decorated, and at least our room had a small kitchen, which is very convenient if you are traveling with small children (3 and 6 years old). The cleaning of the rooms is again impeccable, again something that is put to the test if you are traveling with small children. The breakfast is something out of the ordinary. The weekend we were there was tomato week, which means they served a variety of tomato-related dishes, on top of everything else that you normally expect from a buffet breakfast. The standard of everything on the buffet was excellent and you could easily tell that every item on it, including the yoghurts, the pancakes, and you name it, had been carefully prepared. Afternoon tea or coffee with a piece (or two) of cake is available for self-service at the rooftop terrace, which is nice. The location of the hotel is convenient. You find at least 50 restaurants within 10 minutes walking distance. It takes 5-10 min to walk to Gedächtniskirche. You find a subway station two min from the hotel, where you can go directly to Gedächtniskirche, Potzdamer Platz or Alexanderplatz. If you drive, you reach the hotel from the Autobahn in about 5 min. The hotel offers plenty of parking space. To sum up, it may sound like I’m employed by the hotel, but I’m not. I’m just a truly impressed guest. I have stayed at plenty of hotels and always aim for four or five stars as a first selection criterion, but this hotel beats them all due to the very high quality of every piece of its offering. There is but one weakness: the elevator stops in-between floors, so you will have to walk up half a floor to reach your room.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a good area”
Reviews.Author: ckdexterhaven
Reviews.Content: my daughters and i stayed at hotel otto for three nights. we had a comfort room, that has twin beds and a day bed, not a rollawaybed. the room was very big, about 35 sq.m, very modern, very clean and well equipped with desk, lamps, stool and armchair, it also has a walk in wardrobe. the bathroom too was very practical and had aveda products. breakfast is served on the seventh floor til 11 am (after 11 you can help yourself with complimentary cake, tea, coffee and mineral water) and it is good, rich and healthy, staff is very kind and helpful; they stored our luggage after check out and lent us umbrellas, besides providing us with useful infos and map. the area is quiet and safe, u-bahn and s-bahn close by, lots of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden jewel in Charlottenburg”
Reviews.Author: CVHBH
Reviews.Content: A beautiful boutique hotel in the middle of a trendy safe neighbourhood with theatres,cafes, shops and wonderful restaurants within a short walking distance. The staff were very helpful and spoke English fluently. The hotel is within steps to both the U & S-bahn. The breafasts were lovely on the 7th floor lounge with a nice view of the neighbouring city on the terrace. The suite was large, well appointed and clean. A great find !

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing catalogue of errors”
Reviews.Author: g109
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the strength of the Tripadvisor reviews and stayed here for three nights in December 2008. I may very well have been unlucky but I left distinctly underwhelmed at the whole experience. It didn’t start well. The Reception is not 24 hours and as I was arriving late, I emailed the hotel a few days in advance to let them know and ask how I could retrieve the key. Sadly, my email went without a reply so I got a German-speaking colleague to call and organize this for me. On the phone they mentioned that they had replied, but their emails to me had bounced back – this I accept is perfectly possible and so I was happy to receive the code and make the arrangements to arrive late. However, as I had given my phone number in the booking, if they had really tried to contact me, why couldn't they have phoned when the emails kept bouncing back? Arrival was very easy, just entered the code into the keypad and my key popped out. I let myself in and that was that. The room was fine, very clean with a safe and a work desk. It was extremely hot but once I found the radiator, I was able to adjust the temperature. The next day, I went out and on returning, late in the afternoon, I found that my room had not been serviced. I mentioned this to reception who said that the cleaner had now gone home and that it would have to be serviced tomorrow. I was fine with that as she was kind enough to replace the towels. Now, one of the reasons I booked this hotel over others was the free wifi, which unfortunately, gave up the ghost on my second evening. It wasn’t repaired until Monday morning which meant that I went without it for most of my stay. One can forgive one small error, such as the room not being serviced or an email not being replied to, but three is really stretching it. Moreover, the hotel claims to offer free coffee and cake in the afternoon and I found a stale piece of chocolate muffin and cold coffee. The management were kind enough to offer me complimentary breakfast on the last day but sadly I had to refuse as I had an appointment. They did take EUR10 off of the bill for the lack of wifi and room servicing but that was only after I insisted on this and had I not, I feel that they wouldn’t have done so. As I mentioned at the start, I may very well have been unlucky with this stay given the positive reviews elsewhere. The room was clean, when it actually was serviced, and the hotel was very easy to reach being less than 15 minutes from Tegel Airport on the X9 bus (get off at Ernst Reuter Platz). Still, this hotel is not at all suitable for disabled travellers – the elevator stops between floors and doesn’t reach the breakfast room. Would I stay here again? Probably not. Would I recommend it to anyone? Again, no but there are many happy clients out there who think differently.

Reviews.Title: “great value, location, room, service”
Reviews.Author: bongomoppet
Reviews.Content: very good value for the money...nicely located...near S-Bahn, U-Bahn, shopping, restaurants..staff was very helpful and friendly. Hotel was simple, but nice. lovely breakfast on top floor and could sit outside and enjoy the view. also, coffee, tea and mineral water available all day in the breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Otto!”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonFritz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Otto with family (11yr old son) and really liked some the features that we didn't encounter anywhere else on our trip: 1 - Largest room of our trip. 2 - Large storage area (room) were we kept our luggage,shoes,daily collectables and hung our clothes. 3 - Free Wi-Fi. 4- Comfortable bed for my son. Not a pull-out sofa bed were you usually feel every last spring. The hotel was also kept very clean and spotless, the area is excellent with many near-by restaurants, the breakfast room with buffet is excellent and the staff was very helpful with tips,advice and maps. The parking (for a fee) was handy as well. The parking in Berlin is otherwise terrible. The daily replenishment of AVEDA bath products was a nice little touch as well!. We would definately stay here again. My son really liked the rooster sound in the elevator....just press Uber-raschung.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: Carl_hammond
Reviews.Content: Hi, we stayed here for two nights. Service at reception was helpful and friendly with maps and lots of advice. The room we got face out over a car park. The rooms were clean, however very plain with no fridge and large areas of empty space. Howver what let things down was the breakfast. It probably was good at 7am when set up, but was poorly relpenished on both mornings. Milk was in a container that stank of sourness and there was next to nothing left. We were far from the last ones in for breakfast either. Al and all for the price we paid, we would expect far better.

Reviews.Title: “We will recommend this hotel to everybody!”
Reviews.Author: Melovechocolate
Reviews.Content: We arrived and were welcomed by "Peter",who was very nice, welcoming,considerate (he insisted on helping me with our heavy bags, which my sons were hauling),and helpful. The room was large, spotless, decorated in a very minimalist-elegant style with just what you need to be comfortable: the beds (I asked for a triple and all three beds were ready), a long table with a stool, a flatscreen TV, several toiletries, FREE WiFi and Aveda products--I loved this place! It was clean, quiet, not too far from the "U2" line metro (station ERNST-REUTER PLATZ). That's why I didn't give the location a 5, because it's not exactly centrally located (although there a plenty of little cafes and restaurants), but you can get anywhere from the metro station. My kids (ages 8 & 10) also loved this place. I agree with previous postings calling this hotel a "gem" !!!!

Reviews.Title: “A real gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: medway99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in July and had a fantastic stay. The staff were very helpful and friendly - nothing was too much trouble. The hotel was excellent value for money from the outstanding breakfast to the complimentary tea, coffee and cakes, not forgetting the complimentary bottled water. Also the rooms were large and very clean and quiet, which is unusual in today's frentic world. The hotel is also situated very close to two UBahn stations, being only about a six/seven minute walk. . We would most definitely stay here again if we returned to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: zzkk
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. The waa is excellent. The rooms are perfect, the service fantastic, and the location very good. I don't recall a more pleasurable hotel stay or better value in several years. On the negative side, there is no AC, no room service (not needed, since there are several nearby restaurants that deliver), and no gym. There is also no real desk.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem of a hotel, would return again and will recommend it to friends.”
Reviews.Author: eurotripperbath
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Otto after hours of internet hunting for a reasonably priced, smart hotel which is easy to get to, having never visited Berlin before. So glad we did. This is a real find! Tucked away in a tree lined street, in a lovely area, but with easy access to the city and public transport, Hotel Otto was perfect for us. My husband tipped them off that we were celebrating our wedding anniversary and they upgraded our room and there was a big bowl of fresh strawberries waiting for us, what a welcome! The staff were really helpful with all our requests and give really useful information to help us make the most of our trip. There is a direct link to the airport from Savignyplatz station which is about 10 minutes walk away. I think that if we returned we would definately consider hiring bikes, although the efficiency of the public transport compared to the UK's makes me weep; cheap and on time. One more thing you should know about Hotel Otto, the breakfast is immense! It kept us going til mid-afternoon when we were just about ready for a kaffe und kuchen somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Otto is hotto”
Reviews.Author: nysingle
Reviews.Content: First of all, how could you not love a hotel that sells beer from a vending machine? For 2 euros, you can get a nice cold Beck's from the Coke machine downstairs. Mmmmm. The hotel itself is nice. My room was nice and roomy, and despite being on the ground floor near reception, it was not noisy at all. The WiFi worked well; I don't think there was a computer available to use. There is parking at the hotel, but I saw plenty of street parking too. I liked the location, a nice quiet area near the Zoo. It's about a 10 minute walk from the Zoo station and about 2 minutes from Ernst Reuter Pla. There are a ton of nice restaurants in the area (2-3 block walk). As noted, the closest supermarket / convenience stores are by the Zoo (not very close), and they close pretty early (often by 8). It's about 20-30 minutes from Hbf. The room was clean, nice size shower, comfy bed, helpful staff. The reception is not open 24/7, so I'm not sure what they do for late arrivals / lost keys and stuff, but I didn't have any issues. I would absolutely book the Otto again for a return trip. The price was right (<$100/night during summer), and it was a great find. And of course, the beer from the vending machine thing hooks me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, modern, clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: tripzec
Reviews.Content: Hotel Otto is clean and quiet, its rooms are beautiful, the price is very reasonable, the staff are the most friendy staff I have ever encountered in a hotel and, to top it all off, the breakfast is top quality. I will definitely stay there in future. The only downside is that it is slightly further from the attractions in the east of the city; but these are a two minute walk + 10 minute train ride away.

Reviews.Title: “if in berlin to be in the west side, would come back for sure”
Reviews.Author: viajante2009
Reviews.Content: great service, very nice room, helpful staff, great breakfast and great having snacks all day long, but if you are in the berlin for the first time, wouldn't say it is the perfect location to feel the vibe of the city. if you are there to be in the west side, would definetely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: canziano
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and I have to say this is a perfect place. Close to the zoo (and bus station), 30 metres from a bus stop if you don't fell like walking at all. Very clean and stylish room. And was quite cheap, so for sure a great value for the money. Will definitely recommend it if going to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Another fan of Hotel Otto”
Reviews.Author: honeymonsterWales
Reviews.Content: The hotel is of modern minimalist design (in reply to the earlier review - that's why there are no pictures on the walls). Our room (a 'Comfort' room with two extra single beds for the kids) was spacious even with the extra beds. Everything worked, all the usual extras (hairdrier, range of soaps and shampoos, etc) were there, the staff were friendly and spoke excellent english, etc, etc. In other words, everything was just as described by all the other positive reviews for this hotel. We didn't have the breakfast there (12 Euros per head is a bit steep for four people each day for a week), but there are a couple of excellent cafes within literally a few yards. Turn right out of the hotel and on the corner is a conventional pastry and sandwich selling cafe and turn left, and there is an organic place a couple of doors up and then a few yards further on just around the corner a more up-market joint. We stuck to the first one and managed to get a decent spread for under 20 Euros a day. As others have said, the hotel doesn't have a restaurant, but there are many places to eat around the hotel. We tried several restaurants, all within five minutes' walk at maximum (and that's me walking at a tortoise pace after injuring my foot on day one of the holiday). Damas (on Goethestrasse - cross road outside hotel, turn right, go left at corner with the pharmacy on it, and it's about two shops down) sells excellent Syrian food (if you've not had it, think Turkish but with a little less obsession with cinnamon). Towards the bottom of Knesebeckstrasse (but before you reach Savignyplatz) on the same side of the road as the hotel is Pratirio, which sells Greek Cypriot food. The meze selection was excellent. The Manjurani restaurant (turn left out of the hotel - it's about fifty yards away) on Knesebeckstrasse sells Indian food. In some ways it was like a blast from the past; it was like Indian food was in the UK about twenty years ago before it all got sophisticated. However, it was good filling and unpretentious food. If you're going to bring food back to the hotel, there is a little problem of finding a supermarket. The nearest one we found was Verbrauchermarkt Ullrich. This was across the road from the Zoologischer Garten Station (*very* easily accessed using the superb public transport system). Excellent range of packaged cold meats and cheeses, and more types of drink (alcoholic and non-alcoholic) than you could shake a stick at. We thought the bread was adequate but not thrilling (but there are other bakeries near the hotel you could use). As regards entertainment, etc, we were there for the galleries, museums and zoo, and Hotel Otto is well situated for these. [Tip - get yourself a Berlin card (used enough it will save you money and it will certainly save you time) - this gives you access to bus, train and subway]. The two nearest stations/bus stops are: Ernst Reuter Platz (about two minutes' very slow walk) and Savignyplatz (about five minutes' very slow walk). The whole system is very easy to use. Hope this is of use to someone, and I hope the exchange rate is better when you go than when we did!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mferd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Otto the 20th + 21st of May. The staff was extremely helpful. We requested a fan and extra pillows, which were provided immediately. The staffs english was excellent, our german is not. Recommendations for restaurants were very good (we enjoyed Sachs). The neighborhood had two very nice coffee cafes on the block. I enjoyed sitting in the outdoor cafe for breakfast, we did not eat breakfast at the hotel. There is a big breakfast buffet available for 12 euro per person. But they do provide free coffee, bottled water, and cake in the breakfast lounge all day. It is an easy walk to the S Bahn and on the train to all Berlin's attractions. I would stay at the Otto again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Generally good but some things a little off...”
Reviews.Author: MsKap_Greece
Reviews.Content: I must admit hotel Otto wasn't quite what we were expecting... Not bad - we ended up having a comfortable and pleasant stay - but I'm not sure I would stay there again. We were there for four nights mid-April and I had booked a comfort room based on the positive reviews and VERY reasonable price. Upon arriving, the girl at the reception was super nice and polite, but from the get go I started to get a little worried that this hotel wasn't quite the little boutique place we had in mind. For one, the elevator and stairway system is really bizarre. You have to go down some stairs to take the elevator and then it drops you off between floors so you either have to go up or down a short flight to get to your room. Odd to say the least and a real hassle if you have a lot of luggage!!! Our actual room was HUGE, and I do mean huge, but awfully... bare.... I felt like it was furnished from an IKEA catalogue and never quite finished. There was double bed and two night stands and a hip lounge chair thingie and a bed/couch thingie on the far side of the room and... that was it! No little decorative touches, not a single thing in the wall!! Trust me, the room was huge, and they hadn't hung a single thing on the wall. Can't help wonder what they were thinking - it would've made a big difference in giving the room a little more warmth. There was free wireless which seemed to be a rarity in Germany so that was good... The closet was fabulous - again, HUGE. It was basically a door and when you opened it there was this big walk-in closet with a window and tons of space. That I loved but, again, it seemed a little odd. In proportion to the size of everything else the bathroom was very comfortable and functional but kind of small... you figure with all the empty space in the room they could have made the bathroom a liiiitttle bigger!!! But, okay, no major complaints there. One major gripe and, again, bizarre oversight, was that there was no mini fridge. Given the size of the room you wonder why they didn't just stick a little fridge somewhere in the room... trust me, the extra cost would've been minimal and there was TONS of space!!!! Odd.... So yeah... a little too minimal and spartan for our tastes. Another thing - i specifically asked for a high room with a view and so we had a great room on the 6th floor overlooking the main street but the rooms looking out back were dismal. All the rooms on the back side of the hotel faced the open-air parking garage and some really dinky apartments. I wouldn't have stayed in one of those rooms had you paid me. Some might argue that they might not care about the view but the thought of waking up to a measly parking lot is totally depressing in my book. On the plus side, the location is FABULOUS!!!!! We loved the fact that it was in a quiet and hip residential area with TONS of great restaurants and bars within 2-5 minutes walking distance. Savigny platz is only a couple of blocks down and has a great choice of restaurants - from Spanish to Thai to Greek to German... you name it! One we particularly liked was "Brel" - great filet mignon and desert and atmosphere at very reasonable prices. (Truth be told though Berlin is a city of reasonable prices!!!) There were also great little cafes and pastry stores around for breakfast and the metro was super close. The hotel did offer a breakfast buffet for 12 euro a person and was supposed to fabulous but we never did try it opting to eat breakfast out instead... Another plus was the service - I must admit all the staff were really nice and polite and did the best to accomodate. They gave us lots of advice on sightseeing, tickets, maps, even bringing us a bucket of ice to keep our water and beers cool ! (two words hotel otto - mini fridge!!!!!) So all in all we had a really good time but don't know if I would go there second time around - I would try to find a hotel in the same neighborhood but a little more luxurious... but if that failed we MIGHT go back just because we loved the area so much.... If your tastes run to the more lean and minimal though and you don't mind the absolute bare walls (!!!) then it's good value for money, the location is super, there's tons of closet space (!), and the staff very polite and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal and good location!”
Reviews.Author: OttawaCatLady
Reviews.Content: Hotel Otto is a good deal in a city where many hotels are very expensive. It's in a great location, Charlottenburg, an area which is not only fun to walk around, but well-supplied with good restaurants and transit stations. Rooms are comfortable and quiet. The breakfast, which Expedia offered in our package, was excellent with lots of good choices. The breakfast room, on the top floor, is pleasant and the hotel leaves coffee, tea, and cake out until 10 p.m. if you need a little snack. The fact that most guests were German just led us to believe that the Otto was a good deal indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Homemade cake!”
Reviews.Author: Cosmo80
Reviews.Content: One Saturday morning my fiancé and I quite quickly decided to go to Berlin in order to surprise a friend because it was his birthday. When thinking of a playce to stay "Hotel Otto" came to my mind beucause we had passed it some times during our previous visits and it seemed quite nice. Mind you, it was a lot more than that! The room was decorated in a clean, modern way which reminded me of the "Bauhaus" style. Toiletries were from Aveda, the bathroom was very nice, and the seventh-floor lounge was open all day with complimentary tea, coffee, water, muffins and homemade cake for all guests! Breakfast is not included but well worth the extra mones because this huge choice will answer all your desires! (Different sorts of bread, rolls, croissants, ham, salami, prosciutto, "wurst", various kinds of cheese, fresh vegetables, scrambled eggs, fried eggs, sausages, fried ham, hones, jam, marmalade, "Nutella", four kinds of yoghurts, different kinds of fresh fruit, different seeds, cereals, muffins, cake, juices, water, sparkling wine, tea, coffee, ...) The location (in Charlottenburg) is really good - loads of great restaurants and boutiqes nearby, you can actually walk to Kurfürstendamm and public transport is close.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel - beautiful area - definitely a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Eleni-Nikos-Athens
Reviews.Content: We wanted to celebrate our 2-year relationship anniversary so we picked Berlin! I read almost all reviews available at tripadvisor.com before deciding to stay at this hotel so I felt comfortoble that it would be of our style (comfortable, not redundant luxuries, clean, good bathroom, good breakfast). We had the room #503, a Comfort room, spaceous, a walking closet with windows, a nice bathroom and view at Knesebeckstraße.. just beautiful... The breakfast was fantastic, if you like starting your day with good food full of vitamins and a nice latte macchiatto...The staff was really polite and friendly. From the hotel you can also buy the 3-days tickets for public transport. We loved this hotel and I believe that we will stay here the next time we'll visit Berlin! For more reviews about Berlin and other places (in Greek) visit my personal blog ele-ni.blogspot.com.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Brugge
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable room, excellent breakfast. A pub nearby that is worth visiting: Gainsbourg (at the end of the street near Savignyplatz).

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in west berllin”
Reviews.Author: case4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and had a thoroughly nice time. the first room that we booked- a standard - was too small - and if we hadn't been moved, I can't say that we would have been able to recommend the place, as there was a tiny wardrobe and it was simply too basic. However we were moved to another room on the ground floor which was more spacious - both the room and the bathroom, and that made our stay very pleasant. The breakfast on the 7th floor was healthy and varied and it was good to be able to revisit the seventh floor for coffee and cake after we had been doing the Berlin sights. Nearby we ate twice in Zweibelfisch which is an old formerly smokey pub come bistro. The food was delicious, great value whilst the atmosphere was like an old Soho pub. We also ate in San Marino in Savigny Platz - also very good value for a set menu.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Otto”
Reviews.Author: WelshWoody
Reviews.Content: Spent a long double birthday weekend in Hotel Otto and had a fantastic stay. The staff where always friendly and helpful, catering to all our needs. The rooms had all the facilities we required and where very comfortable and very clean. As it was a double birthday celebration Hotel Otto went out of their way to provide birthday cards, champagne etc. to make each day special and we really appreciated it. It was very impressive of them and made for a great stay. The hotel is situated on Knesebeckstrasse where there are numourous restaurants and bars. You will find a great Indian restaurant with a slightly wacky but very friendly Nepalese waiter near the hotel. The nearest tube stop is Ernst-Reuter Platz, about 200 metres away, where the U-Bahn takes you very quickly into the centre. Probably around 5-15 minutes depending on where you are going. We had a lovely time in Berlin and at Hotel Otto and would definately recommend it to anyone. It is very worthy of being in the Trip Advisor Top 20 Berlin Hotels and at such a reasonable price!!

Reviews.Title: “nOtto Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: gigi_glasgow
Reviews.Content: Otto is in a quiet residential area near some great bars and restaurants and close to the train stations. We were disappointed with the room as we had booked a double but received two single beds pushed together (we were too tired to complain – so perhaps they would have moved us?). For £220 (incl breakfast) for two nights we would really have expected a double bed, cable TV and more than one pillow each. Plus the shower curtain wasn’t long enough to stop water flooding the bathroom! The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ericbee
Reviews.Content: the personel was very friendly and helpfull, the studio we booked was on the 6th floor and near the breakfast lounge. The studio was very spacious and looked very fresh and new. The breakfast was a good value for money 13 euro for all organic bread, topping and yoghurt. The location of the hotel was comfortable near the U-bahn, a 5 minute walk, the KaDeWe was a 20 minute walk away from the hotel. If you're into running, the park: Tiergarten is nearby (5 minute).

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Otto!!”
Reviews.Author: EricRLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. Like other reviewers, I pick a hotel based on reviews from this website. I was not disappointed at all. The rooms were clean and spacious. The breakfast buffet was lovely and included in the stay. Our luggage was lost in transit and the hotel staff insisted on calling the airlines for us. We were able to enjoy the city without having to check on the bags. We stayed for 8 nights and loved it. We'd stay there again in a heart beat. The neighborhood is very nice and the proximity to both the U bahn and the S bahn was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “We'll return to this one!”
Reviews.Author: Advisor10
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with extremely friendly staff. Small and large requests were promptly and efficiently met. The breakfast was one of the best I have ever had, even in Germany where they are often good, and it was served until 11am (until noon at weekends) - which was rather nice when we wanted to sleep late. We simply have nothing bad to say about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good well rounded hotel”
Reviews.Author: feefeefifi
Reviews.Content: Stayed hear with my boyfriend for 4 nights, booked the Hotel after reading review on Tripadviser. Good location with a few good bars and restaurants on the doorstep - Try Florian for a very nice meal or 5euros pizza at Savignyplatz (La Piazza) or excellent bier and bratwurst @ Zwie something or other. We did find the area very quiet tho, so if you are looking for more hustle and bustle or liveliness this maybe isnt the location for you (although it was November...). Some nice touches such as the free tea/coffee and cake in the lounge but we would have preferred coffee facilites in our room. The staff were friendly and dealt with our queries in a professional way but did lack overall friendlyness and didnt really go the extra mile. Overall it is a good location, nice decor, average staff and I would staff there again or recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ROhler
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed at Hotel Otto and were not disappointed. I had read reviews on Tripadvisor and booked a reservation for our stay in Berlin. We had a Comfort room with three beds which was very large and comfortable. I was more concerned about the location and when we arrived I found we were only a 5 minute walk from the Kurfurstendam and block away from the Ernst-Reuter Platz U-Bahn station so access to things around Berlin was very easy. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We arrived early so our room was not quite ready and the front desk attendant had us go to the breakfast room for coffee while the room was prepared. The breakfast on the seventh floor was good and lots to choose from. The hotel itself is on a quiet street with lots of restaurants and cafes around. I would definitely stay at Hotel Otto again and would recommend it to friends traveling to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “very chic and well-run hotel in quiet residential area”
Reviews.Author: homecooking
Reviews.Content: we recently spent two nights in the hotel otto after reading a review about it on tripadvisor -- very stylish hotel (we had a large studio room with wooden floors - important to us) with the most pleasant and helpful staff -- added bonus of free wifi connection in your room -- excellent breakfast on the top floor with lots of natural light -- complimentary coffee and water and cakes all day -- we felt very welcomed by everyone Todd, England

Reviews.Title: “Top notch!”
Reviews.Author: waaaaam
Reviews.Content: Very high quality rooms and stay for the price. Rooms were large and stylish, very clean, modern, faultless with some added extras. Free wifi! A great base to see the city from, pretty close to the zoologischer U-Bahn stop from which it is easy to get to pretty much anyway, especially the airports. Lots of good restaurants nearby with food form all over the globe (although quite tricky to find one selling german food!) excellent bakeries on the corner near the hotel too! Would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nice touches”
Reviews.Author: APerlman
Reviews.Content: I chose the Hotel Otto after reading positive reviews and I was not disappointed -- they care and it shows. I vacation with my family in Europe almost every summer and the Hotel Otto was one of the best experiences I’ve had. The hotel is clean and very well kept, with nice touches like tea and cake left out in the pleasant modern dining room/terrace to be enjoyed in the afternoon and evening (after touring the city, we looked forward to having a little desert on the terrace) and, when we were there, champagne to make mimosas at breakfast. When I arrived, I asked if there was somewhere I could refrigerate my medication and the very helpful and friendly desk clerk upgraded our room to one with a mini-kitchen. The room was good sized with large windows and spare but comfortable furnishings. The location was terrific for us, a very nice neighborhood with lots of restaurants and bus, u-bahn and s-bahn nearby. The Zoo Train Station is within easy walking distance which is where many interesting walking tours leave from (we used Original Berlin Walks). When I left, I discovered at the airport that I had left behind my camera bag. I frantically called the hotel and the clerk immediately found the bag, called a cab and sent it on its way to me. It arrived just in time. When I next visit Berlin, I will certainly stay at the Hotel Otto.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: kgravis
Reviews.Content: Hotel Otto is an amazing find in Berlin. All new and pretty, very clean room, for an affordable price. The location is amazing, close to many, many great restaurants, excellent shopping and U and S bahn stations... The staff is also super nice. All in all a very nice hotel located in a great walking area and close to the most important parts of Berlin. Sure, there's no air conditioning in the rooms, but there's no air conditioning anywhere in Berlin - Germans are very energy-conscious (and I went there at the end of July and the room was totally fine temperature-wise)... 100% recommendable...

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: corneliaWeert
Reviews.Content: The people in Hotel Otto give you the feeling that you are welcome. Service is great and the have a super breakfast. The room is very clean. Location is nearby station, and there are lovely restaurants nearby. There is only one thing, there is no airco and it can be hot in the room. But further its a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist Chic”
Reviews.Author: TokyoJoe
Reviews.Content: Otto Hotel is located in a quiet suburb about 10 minutes walk north of the Ku'Damm, with nearest Savignplatz S-Bahn a 5 minute walk away. There is very little of a reception area, the breakfast room is located on the top floor with commanding views of the rooftops of the city . Breakfast charged at 13 euros, but alternatively, you can find ample establishments outside and around the hotel. Although internet access is free in the hotel, there is no terminal so bring your own laptop. About 10m left of the hotel is a stationary shop which offers internet access for 1 euro/15 minutes. The room I was allocated was situated on the ground floor overlooking the rear car park. It was a very hot day so was glad as room was not air conditioned. Bed was soft and comfortable, had a flat screen TV, bathroom with shower, security safe, hairdryer with complimentary bottle of water and fruit basket. All in all, 65 euros a night booked through Hrs.de , this hotel offers reasonable value. Although I would stay at this hotel again, the plus being the Ku Damm shopping district , many of the tourist attractions are located in east Berlin which I found to be more interesting , full of character with trendy shops including the Galeries Lafayette department store and a vibrant nightlife. If travelling from Schonefeld Airport on S-Bahn, journey time to Savignplatz will take approximately 45-60 minutes taking in many stops on the way. The single fare cost however is only 2.90 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Happy return to the Hotel Otto”
Reviews.Author: the_crafty_traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night 3 June and 1 night 9 June and on both occasions I had fabulous rooms. These were my 3rd and 4th visits to Otto. The place is now like a home from home! Beds are very comfortable in lovely modern rooms which have been renovated since the hotel first opened in 2006. They seem to be in a very stylish decor - minimalistic yet chic - clearly a lot of thought went into the design. Black curtains and colourful head boards. The bathrooms are just gorgeous, and very clean, with lovely walk in showers with a glass door instead of curtains. Rooms all now have their own hairdryer which is a proper plug in one and little extras for the traveller in a basket in the walk in wardrobe as well as a small safe, enough to store cash/passport/papers but not a bag or laptop. I booked single rooms but was given a large double on both occasions as I think the hotel wasn't quite full (lucky me!). There was even fruit in the room and a bottle of complimentary mineral water. The only thing lacking was a ceiling fan or, even better, air conditioning as the temperatures were around 28-33 degrees which was stifling so I kept the window/door open - needless to say one did not really need the lovely feather duvet!! The breakfast buffet was as stunning as ever - I love the fact they have prosecco there so always make a Bucks Fizz as a holiday treat! My only minor gripe is that the hot water samovar often runs dry and needs topping up as I don't drink coffee (which they bring in all sorts of variations) but the staff oblige by filling it up (you need to wait for it boil again) but they will bring me hot water in a pot as well. There is always a weekly "speciality" on the buffet:- week one was Scandinavian and week 2 was Bavarian. The hotel is walking distance to Ku'dam and designer boutiques and has easy access to the whole city thanks to the U-Bahn at Ernst Reuter Platz and the S Bahn at Savigny Platz - the S9 route from here goes direct to Schonefeld Airport. Don't forget to validate travel tickets in the little red machines on stations. The street on which the hotel is situated has loads of restaurants so you need never go far for a meal or eat the same cuisine twice! There are several lovely bakeries as well, so now I always buy a few fancy bread rolls to take home on my last day. Despite the lack of aircon and the sometimes empty samovar this place is a real gem, don't hesitate to book it!

Reviews.Title: “Sooooo nice!!”
Reviews.Author: SigoSema
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband were in Berlin between 17th-19th of May.He did quite a search b4 we go and found Hotel Otto in the end. We were not expecting too much but what we experienced was real good. 1st of all location is perfect.You are surrounded by subway stops. When you walk outside the hotel, everywhere is full of nice restaurants and nice,cozy cafes. IT is only 10 minutes walk to Kurfurstandamm Strasse which is the most popular meeting point in Berlin. Staff is very friendly and the rooms are equipped with evrything you need.Beds are soo fluffy and clean.Towels,floor etc were also very clean and was changed and cleaned everyday. They have a great breakfast lounge with a great breakfast buffet. If you wanna have your breakfast on a big terrace with a wonderful view of Berlin, your place is Hotel Otto. We definetely stay there again if we travel to Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bigbluedk
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Otto is a very nice and small hotel in a very nice area of Berlin. The staff is extremely friendly and the rooms are very nice (especially the family rooms) Don't miss the breakfast buffet. The food is super and you have a great view of Berlin from the restaurant on the 7th floor. Highly recommendable.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel OTTO
HotelInfo.Address: Knesebeckstrasse 10 | Charlottenburg, 10623 Berlin, Germany
